title: For Sale/Trade:  *UPDATED*Smith & Wesson Victory Model .38 Special
location: Rock Hill, Rock Hill, South Carolina
postcontent:
This is a WWII issue Smith & Wesson "Victory Model" 6-shot revolver chambered in .38 Special. The serial number of this gun (V20XXX) places its production in 1942.  The majority of the first 40,000 of these guns were chambered in .38 S&W, so this gun is a rare exception. 

The gun has a 4" barrel, parkerized finish, case-hardened trigger and hammer.  "United States Property" is stamped on the top strap.  Finish is in 90% condition; there is some pitting on the cylinder and slight loss of finish on the right frame.  Performance wise, the gun shoots perfectly, cylinder is tight and the bore is clean.  This gun is build like a brick house and can take some abuse...remember, this is a 70+ year old piece of World War II history!  

The gun does not have the original grips; these were often changed/lost after the war.  The gun currently has an aftermarket Hogue monogrip on it at this time, but original-style wood grips are usually available on eBay for around $30.  This gun is a great shooter and military collector's item all in one!
